measure.name: Residential Cooking Range
measure.description: Adds a cooking range to the building. The range can use either gas or electricity. If there is already a gas or electric range in the building, it is replaced with the user selected range. Users can specify either the annual energy use (in kWh/yr), Benchmark multiplier, or the cooktop and oven energy factors. Users can also sepcify if the gas range uses a glo bar for ignition. Energy use for cases other than simple depends on the number of bedrooms as a way to determine how often the range is use. From BEopt, typical oven and cooktop energy factors for a typical electric range are O_EF = 0.11, C_EF = 0.74. For an induction range, O_EF = 0.11, C_EF = 0.84. For a gas range, O_EF = 0.058, C_EF = 0.4.
measure.modeler_description: Adds a new Electric Equipment or Gas Equipment object with a typical range schedule (the default defined in the Building America House Simulation Protocols: http://energy.gov/sites/prod/files/2014/03/f13/house_simulation_protocols_2014.pdf). If a gas range with a glo bar is selected, the model will have a separate Electric Equipment object to capture it's energy consumption.
